dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 55 RH: Emmett Till Antilynching Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rush introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on January 4, 2021

form.official-title: To amend section 249 of title 18, United States Code, to specify lynching as a hate crime act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Emmett Till Antilynching Act.
Section 249(a) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Whoever conspires to commit any offense under paragraph (1), (2), or (3), shall—

subparagraph.text: if death results from the offense, be imprisoned for any term of years or for life, fined in accordance with this title, or both; or
in any other case, be subject to the same penalties as the penalties prescribed for the offense the commission of which was the object of the conspiracy.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
